DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: SILVEIRA, R. P.;Silveira, Ricardo Peterson;PETERSON SILVEIRA, R.;PETERSON SILVEIRA, RICARDO;PETERSON SILVEIRA

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Doutor em Cincia do Exerccio Fsico e do Movimento Humano (Universit degli Studi di Verona, Itlia) e Cincias do Movimento Humano (Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul, Brasil), com doutorado sanduche na Faculdade de Desporto da Universidade do Porto (bolsista PDSE CAPES), atuando no Laboratrio de Biomecnica do Porto (LABIOMEP). Formao complementar na Universidade de Calgary (Canad), atuando no Human Performance Laboratory e Canadian Sport Institute Calgary. J colaborou com treinadores e atletas de nvel nacional e internacional (no Brasil, na Itlia, no Canad e em Portugal), com passagens pelos departamentos cientficos do ADN Swim Project e do Minas Tnis Clube. Atualmente Professor Substituto no Departamento de Esportes da EEFFTO-UFMG e colaborador externo do Grupo de Pesquisa em Esportes Aquticos da UFRGS (GPEA). Membro dos comits cientifico do XXIV Congress of the International Society of Biomechanics - ISB Brazil 2013 e do XVII Congresso Brasileiro de Biomecnica - CBB 2017. reas de interesse: Biomecnica do esporte e do exerccio; mecnica e energtica da locomoo humana; natao e atividades aquticas; treinamento desportivo.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: PhD in Science of Physical Exercise and Human Movement (University of Verona, Italy) and Human Movement Sciences (Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil). Performed an internship period at hte University of Calgary (Canada), working in the Human Performance Laboratory and Canadian Sport Centre Calgary, running out experiments and biomechanical analysis with many canadian international level swimmers. Member of the Biomechanics and Kinesiology Research Group, Aquatic Sports Research Group and leader of the RP Sport Science. Has participaded in the preparation of national and international level swimmers and is currently member of the Sports Science Department of Minas Tnis Clube. &#10;Granted by the Canadian government (The Emerging Leaders in the Americas Program) and the International Society of Biomechanics (The International Travel Grant).&#10;Member of the scientific committees of the XXIV Congress of the International Society of Biomechanics - ISB Brazil 2013, and the XVII Brazilian Congress of Biomechanics - CBB 2017.&#10;&#10;Main interests: Mechanics and energetics of human locomotion; swimming and aquatic sports; biomechanics of sports and exercise

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Efeitos do uso de nadadeiras sobre a coordenao de nado e a freqncia cardaca no treino de natao
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O objetivo desse projeto verificar os efeitos do uso de nadadeiras sobre a coordenao do nado e sobre a freqncia cardaca. Mensurar a freqncia cardaca, ndice de coordenao de nado, freqncia de braadas, distncia percorrida e velocidade de nado em nadadores. Esses dados mensurados sero comparados com a utilizao de diferentes equipamentos: - sem a utilizao de nadadeiras; - com a utilizao de nadadeiras pequenas e - com a utilizao de nadadeiras grandes. Comparar os resultados entre as diferentes situaes: sem nadadeiras, e com nadadeiras de diferentes tamanhos.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Fora propusiva efetiva durante um palmateio de sustentao - Um estudo de caso
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Propulsive effective force during a support scull - A case study

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Revista Mackenzie de Educao Fsica e Esporte (Online)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: &#10;&#10;The effective propulsive force analysis in each phase of sculling motion may help improving the technique of this movement. Thus, the purpose of this study was to describe the behavior of the effective propulsive force produced by support scull (in a vertical position with head above the waters surface) in each phase of this movement. For this, one swimmer was asked to perform the sculling motion during seven seconds, while videogrammetry and dynamometry were used in order to measure kinematic and kinetic data, respectively. Three cycles of sculling motion were analyzed and each cycle was divided into four phases (in-sweep, transition phase from in-sweep to out-sweep, out-sweep and transition phase from out-sweep to in-sweep). Coefficients of variation showed a different variation of the effetive propulsive force between the phases of the sculling motion, however the value of the force was almost constant during the phases (around 9.5 N), since low standard deviation and coefficient of variance were found.
